comment:
I normally agree with everything you say in your videos as being very factual and accurate.  You're probably not wrong about this one either. However, I just want to make a note that my ex husband was a covert narcissist.  I had never dealt with ANYTHING like him before.  He did what Amber described...someone who had his own storyline of super-over exaggerated extreme vocabulary that didn't accurately portray our situation and there were simply far too many mis-statements to correct them all in any given conversation.  I gradually learned to apologize for anything true he said, ignore the rest and then try to verbally steer the conversation toward a goal (which changed depending on the incident) such as to bring us both to personal responsibility or to how to solve the problem for next time.  Coverts are extraordinary at diversions and retellings.  I would eventually get so frustrated that if a therapist walked in right then, I would look like the only one upset and he would be calm, cool collected and happy with himself for making me look nuts to a stranger.  So, as I gradually learned more, I learned how to stay calm, how to walk away and not try to get to a goal.  When I hear the two of them, I recognize Johnny's communication sounding much like my ex..calm but making false accusations the whole time, telling a false narrative which upsets the "victim" and confuses them and they apologize to fix it.  However Amber using violence is not ok and maybe she's a narc too but consider the possibility that she may be telling more truth than we assume.  Maybe she's an overt narc and he's a covert narc and they met their match in each other.  He does admit he would drink and do drugs and become a monster and he said he couldn't contain it.  So I know Johnny is much more likeable than her but I wouldn't presume his innocence unless you're privy to ALL the facts.  If my ex was in court, I'd smile hearing his absurd retellings and roll my eyes about it and that's not me having duping delight, it would be an incredulous shock that anyone believed his crap.  I'm not following the case closely, so maybe I'm wrong.
I remember Johnny telling really disturbing dark stories that you can google so I don't know if Hollywood has many "innocent" people.
I agree with not victim blaming normally.  I'm just not sure he's innocent.  The public would have forgotten about it along time ago if he hadn't sued.  They originally both signed a paper agreeing that they both abused each other.  Why is his story changing?
